Task.title: Task
Task.description: Represents a task in the Task Master application.

id.description: Unique identifier for the Task entity.

description.description: A detailed description of the task.

isCompleted.description: Indicates whether the task is completed or not.

definition.description: Stores tasks owned by a specific user. Authorization is based on path ownership, ensuring only the authenticated user (userId) can access their tasks. Includes the task details such as title, description and completion status.

params.name: userId
params.description: The unique identifier of the user.

params.name: taskId
params.description: The unique identifier of the task.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to ensure secure and efficient management of tasks within the Task Master application. The core principle is Authorization Independence, achieved by storing tasks in user-specific collections, thus eliminating the need for complex authorization rules that rely on parent document data. Tasks are stored under `/users/{userId}/tasks/{taskId}` to ensure that only the user who owns the tasks has access to them. This path-based ownership drastically simplifies security rules. This structure also allows for easy listing of tasks for a specific user. It provides robust QAPs (Rules are not Filters) because listing will be simple and secure.
